column4: is it normal for an install of winxp to take 2.5 hours using qemu?
yes.
its entirely normal.
thanks
you can use kqemu (a proprietary kernel module which makes things go faster in qemu)
but i dont recommend it
why not?
I tried using kqemu while installing but the installation pagefaulted
because it is proprietary!
do you know what proprietary means?
i read something about an open source equivalent to kqemu
well,  don't use it. it is too alpha.
thats what I thought
do you understand what the problem is with kqemu?
it's proprietary!!
that isn't complete understanding. yes, it's proprietary...
but it means that if, say, you wanted kqemu to be fast, you couldn't do it, or hire someone else to do it for you.
or, if you wanted to promote kqemu by bundling it, you couldn't do it without asking.
are there comparative open source alternatives to qemu?
for running xp
not really.
ok, can I expect a significant performance increase if I add, say a gig of ram ( i am using 128 for the VM currently)
